name: Chronic Idiopathic Urticaria with Angioedema
chief_complaint: I keep getting these itchy hives that won't go away, and sometimes my lips swell up
physical_findings: Erythematous wheals on trunk and extremities
treatment: Short course oral corticosteroids for flares
prognosis: Variable - 50% resolve within 1 year, but may persist for years. Generally not life-threatening but significantly impacts quality of life.
description: A chronic form of hives (urticaria) with accompanying angioedema lasting >6 weeks without identifiable trigger. Believed to involve autoimmune mechanisms with mast cell activation. Distinct from acute allergic reactions as it's not IgE-mediated.
